H0.text: Net primary productivity is an estimation of all of the organic matter available as food and involves measuring biomass in terrestrial environments.

H1.text: The food chain is an estimation of all of the organic matter available as food and involves measuring biomass in terrestrial environments.

H2.text: Decomposition energy is an estimation of all of the organic matter available as food and involves measuring biomass in terrestrial environments.

H3.text: Trophic level total is an estimation of all organic matter available as food and involves measuring biomass in terrestrial environments.

A4.text: In terrestrial ecosystems, researchers generally measure net primary production (NPP).

A5.text: Most frequently, peak standing biomass is assumed to measure NPP.
